abstract: Marc Tracy On Basketball column questions whether young basketball players will seek to follow in footsteps of Emmanuel Mudiay, who Denver Nuggets drafted at No 7; notes that Mudiay, who skipped college to play professionally in China, received seven-figure salary and penned deal with Under Armour; examines consequences such a viable path may have for college basketball.
lead_paragraph: While it is still too soon to tell whether Emmanuel Mudiay’s journey through China to the N.B.A. draft marks the beginning of a trend, some young players might be lured by the riches associated with playing overseas as the N.C.A.A. sorts through legal battles.

headline.main: Road to N.B.A. Is Taking Detour Around College
headline.print_headline: Road to the N.B.A. Is Increasingly Taking a Detour Around College
